greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least number k>n such that k^2 divides n^k - 1.
comment: For prime p, p divides a(p+1). Quotients a(p+1)/p for prime p = A000040(n) are listed in A128456(n) which coincides with A128357(n) for n from 2 to 6.
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Mar 05 2007. Mar 09 2007
ext: Terms a(22) onward from _Max Alekseyev_, May 05 2010
